timeline.bodyText: nit: do we want to print out the entire payload or just the name?
timeline.author: ipotuzhnov

replies.bodyText: I'd prefer to just list the names here.
replies.author: irataxy

replies.bodyText:
Then we should probably do something like this:
System.out.println(jt.getName());

Then we should probably do something like this:

replies.bodyText: Note for Java, longer names are preferable.  (Unlike Go)
replies.author: lesv

timeline.author: ipotuzhnov

timeline.bodyText: Should the error be handled here?
timeline.author: ipotuzhnov

timeline.bodyText: Why do we use both of these?
timeline.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: PROJECT_NUMBER is used to verify the API responses, which translate the project name into a project number
replies.author: irataxy

timeline.bodyText: This seems like overkill and confusing to users.
timeline.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: This is for the internal test project only.
replies.author: irataxy

timeline.bodyText: Why is this using PROJECT_NUMBER?  It's supposed to take both and our samples prefer PROJECT_ID.
timeline.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: The API response includes the project number in place of the project id per https://google.aip.dev/cloud/2510.
replies.author: irataxy

timeline.bodyText:
It's better to do this in the @Before method as it's possible (though unlikely) that someone might change this in another class before this one loads.  (note - feel free to ignore this)
Note we are adding Junit rules soon that will make doing this moot.
timeline.author: lesv

timeline.bodyText: Why are you catching and ignoring?  as above, if you catch, you should do something, if you wish to ignore an exception, please say so.  Typically using the word "expected" as the variable name. https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s6.2-caught-exceptions
timeline.author: lesv
lesv
lesv
lesv
lesv

timeline.message: Add UUIDs to bucket and job template names for tests
